description: From Middle English attern, from Old English ǣtren (“poisoned, poisonous, venomous”), from Proto-West Germanic *ait(t)rīn (“poisonous”). Equivalent to atter +‎ -en.

adjectives.description: attern (comparative more attern, superlative most attern)

entries.meaning: (UK dialectal, of people) Cruel; fierce; ill-natured.
